content: beginner s square-ish washcloth b y yoli bacon this project will teach you to create a square-ish washcloth the more consistent you are with your gauge and stitches the closer to square it will be but if it s not totally square don t worry practice makes perfect and one skein of the recommended yarn will make at least two w ashcloths this pattern is written using standard crochet terminology while the stitch sequence is easy to memorize try to get used to reading and referring to your pattern as this will help you when you w ork on more complicated projects in the future materials 1 skein cascade avalon any color or yarn of your choice 100% cotton and cotton-blend yarns are recommended s ize h 5 0mm crochet hook stitch definitions chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet skip = skip slip_stitch = slip_stitch s t = stitch c hain 23 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across 22 single_crochet 2 ch1 turn single_crochet in 1st chain skip 1 st * single_crochet in next st ch1 skip next st * repeat from * to * until last st single_crochet in last st 12 single_crochet 10 ch1 space 3 ch1 turn single_crochet in 1st st ch1 skip next st * single_crochet in next st ch1 skip next st * repeat from * to * until last st single_crochet in last st 12 single_crochet 10 ch1 space 4-20 repeat row 3 21 ch1 turn single_crochet in each single_crochet and ch1 space across to last st 3sc in last st rotate work clockwise to work on next side 22 * work 1sc in ends of each row 20 single_crochet until last row * work 3sc in side of last row rotate work clockwise to work on next side 23 repeat row 21 2 4 repeat row 22 from * to * in last single_crochet work 2sc join with slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet of border row b ind off weave in ends copyright 2014 yolanda bacon
